channel.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
channel.description: ok ppl i always wanted too see how big is the black messa... i loocked in google for it but i dont think i ll find it any time soon.... it would be great if ayone helps me.... :slight_smile: :slight_smile:

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
ripa:

Also no antialiasing, because Blender’s real renderer screws up all the textures and renders polygons inside-out for some reason.

Just a quick thought from a Blender newbie:

Have you checked the polygons’ normals? I know you’ve probably already thought about this but sometimes the simplest things are the most-overlooked. Just a guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: Assassin
item.description:
ripa:




Finally done with all the 78 map pieces. Since Nem’s Crafty (the tool I couldn’t have done this without) doesn’t export lightmaps, there is no proper lighting. Also no antialiasing, because Blender’s real renderer screws up all the textures and renders polygons inside-out for some reason :freeman:

I thought about coloring the route from start to finish with a single color with an increasing saturation or brightness so that the route could be easier to follow.

PS. the deepest part is of course the box-smashing room.

lol great job this is one of rear times when i say i would have done so…
GJ again… happy to be inspirator of something nice

i have a one question the rocket you launch after railways isnt the rocket you see when rideing the train?

Read full topic

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: bobandquizo
item.description:
NotToBeFound:

Back when I was in middle school and highschool I wrote my own sequel to Half-Life (99-2001ish), I called it Half-Life 2: Earth Annihilation.

It was on a couple big fanfic sites (particularly Half-Life.net’s writer’s block). I managed to write 50+ pages of it but got kind of board and ran out of steam… I have since attempted to re-write and “mature-ize” my writing, as some of it was my style of writing at an immature and lower level… I never finished that either… but anyhow, my version of Half-Life 2 is way different than Valve’s obviously…

Anyhow, in my story, Black Mesa was huge… miles upon miles in the desert. I think I had wrote that it was 20 miles in diameter or something, really big.

Anyone ever heard of the Savannah River Site? Former cold-war nuclear materials facility situated near the border of Georgia and South Carolina? I live right down the street from there.


The huge green blob, is the Site. It had 5 reactors at one time. Somewhat trippy. I was thinking similar to that but much larcher and more barren as the desert is obviously.

Is your story still on the Internet? It sounds cool, I’d love to be able to read it.:freeman:

Read full topic

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: ripa
item.description:
Can you post the source file? Please?

Sorry, Valve’s copyright.

Great, now do City 17!

Nah. Surface areas are the most annoying and boring part to map.

About that WIP Black Mesa Map: What do you make it with?

I did it just for fun. I had the idea years ago but never followed through with it. Freeman’s Mind inspired me to revisit the idea and thanks to Crafty’s exporting capabilities and Blender it was pretty simple to do. I thought you guys might find the map interesting (google found this thread when I was checking if anyone else had made such a map).

Also, I won’t be doing the color route thingy, because Blender can’t render one-sided polygons. Without lighting it’d look dull.

Mod idea: Isometric Half-Life :freeman:

Read full topic

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: Scorpion42
item.description:
One day i was surfing around in Half-Life Deathmatch: Source when i suddenly came across a server running the map blackmesa_005. It was the entire chapter of Anomalous Materials welded together with Npcs, triggers; the shit. Unfortunately i didn’t realise the value of this map and deleted it later. It has never been run since…

About that WIP Black Mesa Map: What do you make it with?

Finally done with all the 78 map pieces. Since Nem’s Crafty (the tool I couldn’t have done this without) doesn’t export lightmaps, there is no proper lighting. Also no antialiasing, because Blender’s real renderer screws up all the textures and renders polygons inside-out for some reason :freeman:

I thought about coloring the route from start to finish with a single color with an increasing saturation or brightness so that the route could be easier to follow.

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: ripa
item.description:
Blast pit’s location could actually be lowered. One map break happens in a moving elevator (the map data doesn’t have any elevator shaft), so I can freely choose blast pit’s vertical location. Also, surface tension happens after freeman gets clobbered, so its vertical location could be chosen freely. Or maybe the blast pit is inside a mountain

Read full topic

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
You’re probably going to need a lot of lights - I’m by no means an expert, I pretty much just mess around with the lights until I get something I’m reasonably happy with. I would just google it.

AO is in the Shading buttons, world subbuttons I believe - just enable it, don’t use approximate. It shares a panel with Stars/Mist/etc. Sky settings are in that one too.

As for the map, yeah, I guess it doesn’t overlap that much, but it still doesn’t make sense. I mean, ST is below blast pit? (random example, don’t know if it’s actually the case)

Read full topic

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: ripa
item.description:
I haven’t spent any time setting up a camera or lighting so I can’t use F12 yet. I’ll get to that when I’m done laying out the parts. I haven’t modified the map’s geometry at all (with the exception of one mistake I made), so it overlaps at some points - overall not nearly as often as you’d think from looking at the 2D map.

edit: any lighting tips? Say, a quick tutorial on setting up a skylight/ambient occlusion.

Read full topic

item.title: Geographic Map of Black Messa....
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
Don’t press the little button to the far right, I’m guessing that’s what you’re pressing. Either press F12 or go to the render buttons in the buttons window and press the render button.

EDIT: although that is really impressive… Is it a inch-for-inch representation or did you change it to make it fit? ie does it overlap?

Read full topic
